H0.text: Biology is the branch of science to which Maria Mitchellâ€™s 1847 comet discovery, later named after her, contributed.

H1.text: Chemistry is the branch of science that Maria Mitchell's 1847 comet discovery, later named after her, contributed to.

H2.text: Geology is the branch of science to which Maria Mitchell's discovery of a comet in 1847, later named after her, contributed.

H3.text: Astronomy is the branch of science to which Maria Mitchell contributed when she discovered a comet in 1847 that was later named after her.

A4.text: In 1847, she discovered a comet named 1847 VI (modern designation C/1847 T1) that was later known as 'Miss Mitchell's Comet' in her honor.

A5.text: Mitchell was the first internationally known woman to work as both a professional astronomer and a professor of astronomy after accepting a position at Vassar College in 1865.
